intro: Castilleja arctica subsp. vorkutensis, commonly known as the Arctic milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and typically grows in tundra and alpine environments. The plant has yellow flowers and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. It forms symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi to obtain nutrients. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
